title_en: MeltwaterBench: Deep learning for spatiotemporal downscaling of surface meltwater
title_zh: MeltwaterBench：基于深度学习的表面融水时空降尺度研究
summary_en: The Greenland ice sheet is melting at an accelerated rate due to processes that are not fully understood and hard to measure. The distribution of surface meltwater can help understand these processes and is observable through remote sensing, but current maps of meltwater face a trade-off: They are either high-resolution in time or space, but not both. We develop a deep learning model that creates gridded surface meltwater maps at daily 100m resolution by fusing data streams from remote sensing observations and physics-based models. In particular, we spatiotemporally downscale regional climate model (RCM) outputs using synthetic aperture radar (SAR), passive microwave (PMW), and a digital elevation model (DEM) over the Helheim Glacier in Eastern Greenland from 2017-2023. Using SAR-derived meltwater as "ground truth", we show that a deep learning-based method that fuses all data streams is over 10 percentage points more accurate over our study area than existing non deep learning-based approaches that only rely on a regional climate model (83% vs. 95% Acc.) or passive microwave observations (72% vs. 95% Acc.). Alternatively, creating a gridded product through a running window calculation with SAR data underestimates extreme melt events, but also achieves notable accuracy (90%) and does not rely on deep learning. We evaluate standard deep learning methods (UNet and DeepLabv3+), and publish our spatiotemporally aligned dataset as a benchmark, MeltwaterBench, for intercomparisons with more complex data-driven downscaling methods. The code and data are available at $\href{https://github.com/blutjens/hrmelt}{github.com/blutjens/hrmelt}$.
summary_zh: 由于尚未完全理解且难以直接观测的物理过程，格陵兰冰盖正加速消融。表面融水的分布有助于理解这些过程，并可通过遥感技术进行观测，但现有的融水分布图面临一个权衡：它们要么具有高时间分辨率，要么具有高空间分辨率，但无法同时兼顾二者。本研究开发了一种深度学习模型，通过融合遥感观测数据和基于物理模型的输出数据，生成每日100米分辨率的网格化表面融水分布图。具体而言，我们利用2017年至2023年格陵兰东部黑尔海姆冰川区域的合成孔径雷达（SAR）、被动微波（PMW）数据及数字高程模型（DEM），对区域气候模型（RCM）的输出结果进行了时空降尺度处理。以SAR反演的融水数据作为“地面真值”，我们发现：在研究区域内，融合所有数据源的深度学习方法比仅依赖区域气候模型（准确率83% vs. 95%）或仅依赖被动微波观测（准确率72% vs. 95%）的非深度学习方法，准确率高出10个百分点以上。此外，虽然通过SAR数据滑动窗口计算生成网格化产品的方法会低估极端融水事件，但也取得了显著准确率（90%），且无需依赖深度学习。我们评估了标准深度学习方法（UNet和DeepLabv3+），并发布了时空对齐的数据集作为基准测试平台——MeltwaterBench，用于与更复杂的数据驱动降尺度方法进行比较。代码与数据公开于 $\href{https://github.com/blutjens/hrmelt}{github.com/blutjens/hrmelt}$。
